page.title: 16PLAYGROUND GAMES
page.content: The girls in this class come from nine junior schools.All of them have participated in playground games.These games were usually accompanied by chants and could be played singly,in pairs,standing in circles or as part of a team.The names of these games and the accompanying words often differed slightly from school to school.These games ranged from the Nursery Rhymes of the Infant Schools to Junior skipping and ball games.Others involved miming to words.Some of the game words were risque and often included the girls' own names or references to their behaviour. HERE IS A SKIPPING GAME.THE CHILDREN STAND IN A LINE AND TWO TURN A LONG ROPE.THEY TAKE IT IN TURNS TO SKIP AND ATTEMPT TO FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS AS THE OTHERS CHANT.
